items.prompt:
Role: You are a Narrative Designer specializing in "branching path" educational games for second language learners.
Tasks: i) Expand the following story topic into a complex, non-linear "Story Blueprint." ii) Design a splash image to introduce the story.
Topic: {topic} 

Blueprint Requirements:
The Critical Path: Define the main journey (Start to Successful Conclusion).

The "Detour" (Side Quest): Create one mandatory detour where the player must go to a specific location to find an item (e.g., a key, a bribe, or information) before they can progress on the main path.

The "Puzzle/Gate": Identify a specific moment where the story "checks" if the player has the item or knowledge from the Detour.

Character "Surprises": List 2 unexpected traits or actions for the NPCs (e.g., the dragon doesn't want to fight, the prince tries to "help" but makes things worse).

Branching "Width": Identify 3 choice points where the story splits into completely different scenes for at least 3 steps before merging back.

Failure States: Describe 2 "Bad Endings" (one humorous, one based on a logical mistake).

State Variables: List 3 variables to track (e.g., $has_item, $prince_annoyance, $bravery_points).

Output (data1): Provide a structured outline with headings. Do not write code yet. Focus on the "logic" of the adventure and making it interesting for a student. 
Output (data2): Write an image generation prompt for a poster image with the main characters and one representative scene from the story. The prompt should specify the image style: {imagestyle}

You are writer who writes interesting stories for second language learners.

Create a first person interactive fiction story (fictionyarn) in yarn 2.0 format using the following story blueprint: [{blueprint}].

Story instructions.
The story should include dialogs between characters, and options that the reader must choose from. 
Options may jump to different nodes of the story . 
In an option set there must be more than 1 option and no more than 4 options.
The language of the story should be: {language}
The story vocabulary should be of difficulty that is comprehensible for learners at language level: {languagelevel}
There should be more then 10 and fewer than 70 story nodes.
Node titles must contain no spaces and be in English.
The title of the first node must be: Start
Character names should have no spaces.
The story should be written in Yarn version 2.0 . 


Extra Yarn Instructions
Generate Yarn Spinner 2.0 code that is compatible with bondage.js.
* Do not use +=, -=, *=, /= anywhere
* Use only <<set $var = expression>> assignments
* Do not use English keywords (to) in set commands
* Close <<if>> conditions with <<endif>>
* Prefer underscores over hyphens in identifiers
The following text is an example of valid Yarn 2.0 for bondage.js

title: Start
---
<<declare $has_map = false>>
Narrator: You stand at the edge of the Whispering Woods. 
-> Enter the woods immediately
    <<jump DeepWoods>>
-> Look for the old guide's hut
    <<jump Hut>>
===
title: Hut
---
Old Man: It's dangerous to go alone! Take this map.
<<set $has_map = true>>
<<jump DeepWoods>>
===
title: DeepWoods
---
Narrator: The trees are thick. You feel lost.
-> Try to find the path <<if $has_map == true>>
    Narrator: The map shows you a secret shortcut!
    <<jump DragonCave>>
-> Wander aimlessly
    Narrator: You walk in circles for hours. The Prince starts complaining.
    <<jump LostFailure>>
===
 
Output Instructions
Your output must include two top-level keys:
1. fictionyarn — the yarn v2.0 format story

lessonDescription: An interactive story with no pics, apart from an introduction screen

user_topic.title: The story outline
user_topic.description: Enter a detailed outline of the story you want to generate.
